awd_titl_txt: LSU-Shreveport, College of Sciences Young Scholars Program
awd_abstract_narration: The College of Sciences at Louisiana State University in                        Shreveport will initiate an eight-week, commuter Young Scholars                 project in Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Mathematics and                Physics for 20 students entering grades 10-12.                                                                                                                  The project will involve courses specially designed for the                     participants in the morning, and research with university faculty               mentors in the afternoon.  Typical research projects will                       involve:  genetic variation in salt tolerant and sensitive                      varieties of cotton, identification of cardenolides in monarch                  butterflies, effectiveness of the neighborhood watch program, and               applying Snyder's coincidence classes to parameter passing in                   Ada.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
